javaClass.shortdesc: This class represents the position of a topic within a tree.

javaClassDetail.apiDesc: The TreeNode class provides methods for traversing a tree collection that contains a topic.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This constructor creates a topic node within a tree collection.

javaParam.apiDefNote: The tree that should contain the constructed node.
The topic for the constructed node.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method gets climbs the tree.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: The topic node or null if there is no node.

javaException.apiDefNote: The topic node exists but couldn't be accessed.

javaMethodDetail.apiDesc: You can use the method to confirm that the node is available before traversal.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: The parent topic node or null if there is no node.

javaException.apiDefNote: The topic node exists but couldn't be accessed.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method gets the child list.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: The child topic nodes or null if there are no child nodes.

javaException.apiDefNote: The child nodes exist but couldn't be put into an array.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method appends a node to the child list, removing the node from its current position if any.

javaParam.apiDefNote: The node to add as a child.

javaException.apiDefNote: The topic node couldn't be appended to the parent node's child list.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method releases resources associated with the nodes.

javaMethodDetail.apiDesc: The class retains nodes until you release them or the garbage collector releases the memory for the class.
